original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽15.73. Saraṇaduka, Upādinnattika🔽Araṇaṁ upādinnupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo naupādinnupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya  saraṇaduka  araṇam upādinnupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na aupādinnupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: The Sarāga-duka, the Upādāna-duka🔽With an object that is not a cause of the taints and is not connected with the taints, a state that is not a cause of the taints and is not connected with the taints arises, having a condition in the form of cause. With the cause condition, there is one … without root-cause, there is one … in the inconsequential, there is one.

original: Araṇaṁ anupādinnaanupādāniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasaraṇo naanupādinnaanupādāniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: araṇam anupādinna anupādāniyam dhammam paṭicca na saraṇaḥ na anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With an object that is not a cause of the taints and is not connected with the taints, a state that is not a cause of the taints and is not connected with the taints arises, having a condition in the form of cause. With the cause condition, there is one … without root-cause, there is one … in the inconsequential, there is one.
